description.narrative: NeEAPR has strengthened evidence, partnerships and resource mobilization capacity that contributing to improved GENDER Equality outcomes., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: EAPR effectively leverages and utilises resources, strategic partnerships, innovations, data and evidence to drive results for children

title.narrative: UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
East Asia and Pacific Regional Evaluation Reports
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: NeEAPR has strengthened evidence, partnerships and resource mobilization capacity that contributing to improved GENDER Equality outcomes.

description.narrative: RO continued its leadership on the Regional Headline Results “Teenage Pregnancy and Child Marriage” and provided technical support to ASEAN and governments/COs in the region, reviewed national actions plans, and conceptualized secondary data analysis and multi-country regional research on pathways to adolescent pregnancy. Related to the prevention of adolescent pregnancy and empowerment of adolescent girls, RO leads innovative work on sexuality education in digital space, girls' digital/tech skills, and has co-created a digital solution with girls to improve access to menstrual health information. EAPRO Gender is a thought leader and key supporter of ‘Innovation & Technology for Gender Equality'. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/08/2020

title.narrative: Regional learning, exchange, and programme strategy to address Teenage Pregnancy and Child Marriage.
Though leadership on innovation and technology for gender equality. (new)
